resources.string: The Colosseum and the Arch of Constantine
built between AD 212 (or 211) and 216/217, during the reigns of emperors Septimius Severus and Caracalla
Viale delle Terme di Caracalla, 00153 Roma RM, Italy
It was the largest amphitheatre ever built at the time and held 50,000 to 80,000 spectators.
Via della Lungara, 230, 00165 Roma RM, Italy
Villa Farnesina is a mansion built between 1505 and 1511 and is one of the most majestic buildings that remain from the Renaissance period in Rome.
Piazza del Popolo, 00187 Roma RM, Italy

Piazza del Popolo is a large urban square in Rome. The name in modern Italian literally means "People's Square", but historically it derives from the poplars (populus in Latin, pioppo in Italian) after which the church of Santa Maria del Popolo, in the northeast corner of the piazza, takes its name.
